document.docAuthor: Fricke, Ronald, Allen, Gerald R., Andréfouët, Serge, Chen, Wei-Jen, Hamel, Mélanie A., Laboute, Pierre, Mana, Ralph, Hui, Tan Heok & Uyeno, Daisuke
document.masterDocTitle: Checklist of the marine and estuarine fishes of Madang District, Papua New Guinea, western Pacific Ocean, with 820 new records

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Checklist of the marine and estuarine fishes of Madang District, Papua New Guinea, western Pacific Ocean, with 820 new records

subSubSection.paragraph:
Anaora tentaculata Gray, 1835
—Tentacled dragonet, leafy dragonet

STATUS AT MADANG. First record from Madang by
Fricke ( 2002 : 9–10 )
. CAS material. DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Eastern Indonesia east to Guam , Palau and Yap, north to Ryukyu Islands, south to New Guinea . Found in harem groups, on sand-rubble bottoms near coral reefs, or in seagrass habitats,
1– 30 m
. Marine.

Callionymus
sp.
(to be described by R. Fricke).—Madang dragonet

Callionymus brevianalis
Fricke, 1983
—Papuan dragonet

STATUS AT MADANG. New record from Madang, based on WAM material ( WAM P. 29595 -021). DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. New Guinea east to Vanuatu , south to Queensland ( Australia ) and New Caledonia . Sand bottoms,
0– 15 m
. Marine.

Callionymus enneactis Bleeker, 1879
—Mangrove dragonet

STATUS AT MADANG. First record from Madang by
Fricke ( 1983 : 122–137 )
. Specimens observed and collected at St. CTR 11 , CTR 26 ; specimens collected by W.-J. Chen. MNHN , NTUM , SMF and USNM material. DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Indonesia east to Guam , Palau , Yap and Solomon Islands , north to southern Japan , south to northern Australia and New Caledonia . Found on soft bottoms in the lagoon, or on sand patches on the reef flat, often associated with seagrass habitats,
0– 15 m
. Transitional water and marine.

Callionymus pleurostictus Fricke, 1982
—Blue-spotted ruddertail dragonet

STATUS AT MADANG. New record from Madang, based on WAM material ( WAM P. 30366 -016). DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Vietnam and eastern Indonesia east to Solomon Islands , north to southern Japan south to northern Australia and New Caledonia . Found on sand bottoms, often near reefs,
0– 22 m
. Marine.

Callionymus zythros
Fricke, 2000
—New Guinea longtail dragonet

STATUS AT MADANG. Originally described from Madang by
Fricke ( 2000 : 62 , fig. 30 )
; previously reported as
Callionymus japonicus
(non Houttuyn, 1782 ) by
Fricke ( 2001 : 3556 , distribution map)
. BPBM material. DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. West
Papua
( Indonesia ) and
Papua New Guinea
. Endemic to New Guinea . Found on soft bottoms of lagoon and slope habitats,
20– 27 m
. Marine.

Diplogrammus goramensis (Bleeker, 1858 )
—Goram dragonet

STATUS AT MADANG. New record from Madang, based on a specimen collected at St. CTR 11 . SMF and WAM material (
SMF 34879
; WAM P. 30366 -011).

DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Vietnam , Philippines and eastern Indonesia east to Marshall and Cook islands , north to southern China , south to Queensland ( Australia ), Norfolk Island and New Caledonia . Found on soft bottoms adjacent to coastal, lagoon and seaward reefs,
0– 34 m
. Marine.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Eleutherochir opercularis
(Valenciennes in Cuvier & Valenciennes, 1837 )
—Estuarine largemouth dragonet STATUS AT MADANG. First record from Madang by
Munro ( 1958 )
; record confirmed by
Fricke ( 2002 : 50 )
. CSIRO material.

subSubSection.paragraph:
DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Sri Lanka and eastern ndia east to Philippines and New Guinea , north to Ryukyu Islands. Found in estuaries, lower reaches of freshwater rivers and streams, and in adjacent mangrove habitats,
0– 3 m
. Fresh water, transitional water and marine.

Synchiropus bartelsi
Fricke, 1983
—Bartels' dragonet

STATUS AT MADANG. New record from Madang, based on WAM material ( WAM P. 30365 -005). DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Central Indonesia east to Philippines and
Papua New Guinea
. Found on sandrubble bottoms,
6– 35 m
. Marine.

Synchiropus circularis Fricke, 1984
—Circular dragonet
STATUS AT MADANG. New record from Madang, based on a specimen photographed by A. Berberian. WAM material ( WAM P. 30633 -002).

DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Central Indonesia east to Mariana Islands , south to Chesterfield Islands. Found in coral reefs,
2– 35 m
. Marine.

Synchiropus claudiae
Fricke, 1990
—Claudia's dragonet

STATUS AT MADANG. Originally described from Madang by
Fricke ( 1990 : 2 , figs. 1–2 )
. SMNS material. DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Queensland ( Australia ) and
Papua New Guinea
,
1– 10 m
. Sand and gravel bottoms in coral reef lagoons. Marine.

Synchiropus ocellatus (Pallas, 1770 )
—Ocellated dragonet

STATUS AT MADANG. New record from Madang, based on WAM material ( WAM P. 30358 -007). DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Eastern Indonesia east to Marshall Islands and Pitcairn , north to Izu Islands ( Japan ), south to northern Australia and New Caledonia . Found on rubble or algae,
0– 30 m
. Marine.

Synchiropus splendidus (Herre, 1927 )
—Mandarinfish

STATUS AT MADANG. First record from Madang by
Fricke ( 1981 : 129 )
. BMNH material. DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Central Indonesia east to Palau , Micronesia and Solomon Islands , north to Rykyu Islands, south to northern Australia and New Caledonia . Found in sheltered coral reef habitats,
0– 18 m
. Marine.
